There are a few steps you should follow to develop mobile applications for your small business:

1. Identify the purpose and objectives of your app: Start by defining what you want your app to accomplish, who is the target audience, and how it will benefit them.

2. Research competitors and similar apps: Study the features, design elements, and user experiences of existing apps in your market or sector.

3. Select a development platform: Choose between native (iOS/Android), hybrid or web technologies depending on factors like cost, required expertise, performance expectations etc.

4. Create an outline or wireframe (a visual representation) of your app: Plan out all screens, navigation components & features based on user flow diagrams using tools like Balsamiq Mockups or Sketch for visualization purposes.

5. Design User Interface (UI) & User Experience (UX): Design the look-and-feel of your application while focusing on ease-of-use following best practices in Mobile App Design Guidelines such as Apple's Human Interface Guidelines for iOS Apps / Google Material Design for Android Apps accordingly.

6. Develop backend infrastructure if needed: Set up databases/servers/APIs as per requirements specified earlier during feature planning stage e.g., hosting service providers like AWS or Firebase can be used here along with cloud storage services/SDKs integration if any external data access/storage management becomes essential part this process
